Description: Rim and body sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery plate; white slip; interior: on rim, maeander pattern between bands; on floor, black-figure decoration consisting of part of lion (top of tail, haunch and body remaining) to right; pendant and full rosettes as filling ornament (with centres flaked off); around edge of rim, band of strokes; underside: solid band at rim; below, band of outlined rectangles with horizontal strokes in centres above a single band; below, lotus flower and bud frieze and two bands.
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in Group A of the Sphinx and Lion Style. The decoration on the vases from this group is the most elaborate. The rosette has a standard cogwheel shape and the figures are carefully drawn and details are expertly incised. The sherd joins Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA 98.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 144, p. 147, p. 319, no. 1406)
Williams 2006a / The Chian Pottery from Naukratis (p. 129, p. 132 note 10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2142) (phase 2)
